title: Toyota wants drivers to top up their tanks with hydrogen from cow manure
text:
Toyota has defended its lagging position in the electric vehicle race by claiming its hydrogen-powered car can be powered for a year by the manure of a single cow.

Chief technology officer Shigeki Terashi said a cow's droppings can be converted to produce enough hydrogen to power its Mirai saloon for 12 months.

The concept car uses a “fuel stack” to convert liquefied hydrogen stored in a fuel cell to electricity, with the only byproduct being water, making the technology zero emission.

Toyota is yet to offer a pure battery electric car and the company – which makes about 10 million vehicles a year – is seen as lagging behind rivals in the field such as VW Group.
